<!-- GETTING STARTED -->

## Getting Started

When setting up the project locally, I suggest removing my workflow file and setting up your own with tools from below section.

### Prerequisites

You should have Node.js LTS & NPM, VSCode, Angular CLI, [Azure Static Web Apps CLI (for local testing)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@azure/static-web-apps-cli), Azure Static Web Apps for VSCode & GitHub Actions for VSCode Extensions and [OpenAPI-Generator-CLI](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@openapitools/openapi-generator-cli) installed.

### Installation

1. Clone the repo
   ```sh
   git clone https://github.com/MateuszKrolik/Customer_Support_AI_ChatBot_FrontEnd.git
   ```
2. Run npm install
   ```sh
   npm i
   ```

<p align="right">(<a href="#readme-top">back to top</a>)</p>

<!-- ROADMAP & USAGE -->

## Roadmap & Usage

- [x] Auto-Generation of a Type-Safe Angular-TypeScript BackEnd API-Client and Schema via "openapi-generator-CLI" package.json script pointing to "/openapi.json" endpoint
- [x] Constructor-based Dependency Injection (DI) of above Auto-Generated Services
- [x] Rxjs (Observables) for Reactive Programming (PubSub Design Pattern) on Data Streams & Events
- [x] Signals for State Management
- [x] Generation of a UUID4 for based on the user's session storage for Simulated Auth
- [x] Reusable, Responsive & Auto-Generated Material Design Pattern Components via Angular Material library with Angular CLI
- [x] ReactiveForms for User Input Handling & Validation
- [x] CI/CD & Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC):
  - [x] Azure Static Web Apps
  - [x] GitHub Actions
  - [x] Azure DevOps
  - [x] YAML
  - [x] Docker
- [x] Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS)

See the [open documentation](https://github.com/MateuszKrolik/Customer_Support_AI_ChatBot_FrontEnd/issues) for a full
list of proposed features (and
known issues).

<p align="right">(<a href="#readme-top">back to top</a>)</p>

<!-- CONTRIBUTING -->

## Contributing

Contributions are what make the open source community such an amazing place to learn, inspire, and create. Any
contributions you make are **greatly appreciated**.

If you have a suggestion that would make this better, please fork the repo and create a pull request. You can also
simply open an issue with the tag "enhancement".
Don't forget to give the project a star! Thanks again!

1. Fork the Project
2. Create your Feature Branch (`git checkout -b feature/AmazingFeature`)
3. Commit your Changes (`git commit -m 'Add some AmazingFeature'`)
4. Push to the Branch (`git push origin feature/AmazingFeature`)
5. Open a Pull Request

<p align="right">(<a href="#readme-top">back to top</a>)</p>
